items.sentence: My French has improved a lot since I started studying with Tom.
I think that my French pronunciation is much better than Tom's.
We'll move into the new house next month if it's ready by then.
The man I met in the park yesterday said that his name was Tom.
I doubt that Tom is the only one who knows Mary's phone number.
If Tom expects Mary to help him, he's going to be disappointed.
With enough motivation, who knows what Tom is capable of doing?
I'm usually the first one to get to work and the last to leave.
Tom lives off the money that he inherited from his grandfather.
All Tom has to do is be there. He doesn't need to say anything.
The game had already started by the time we got to the stadium.
I'm going to buy one of these. I think you should buy one, too.
You're really tired, aren't you? You should go straight to bed.
Tom ate a couple of slices of bread and drank a glass of water.
Tom wanted to buy a pickup truck, but he ended up buying a van.
I bought this piece of property, hoping to build a house on it.
If I'd had a little more money, I could've bought a better one.
We caught a glimpse of the castle from the window of our train.
We'll also have to create a separate smoking section, won't we?
I don't think that Tom will ever get over the loss of his wife.
